learnings.summary:
Methodology: js (version 16+ recommended)
npm install failures: Try npm install --legacy-peer-deps if you get dep
learnings.details:
js (version 16+ recommended)
npm install failures: Try npm install --legacy-peer-deps if you get dependency conflicts
Port 3000 occupied: The dev server will automatically suggest an alternative port

Monitoring Success
You'll know it's working when:

API terminal shows "Server running on http://localhost:8000" (or similar)
UI terminal shows "Local: http://localhost:3000"
Browser dashboard loads without errors

Troubleshooting Strategy
If you hit any snags:

Copy the exact error message - I can provide specific solutions
Check the terminal output - often contains helpful hints
Verify prerequisites: Python, Node

If schema rejects `app_id` in the body, no problem—we go with Option A and wire Notion. Risk Mitigation for Local-First
- Because your memory and automation run locally, Notion holds the **master record** of:
  - All platform configurations
  - Update history
  - Known bugs/fixes  
- If the local server goes down, your processes and content state are still accessible in Notion, so you can resume or redeploy without losing your place. **User:** {'content_type': 'image_asset_pointer', 'asset_pointer': 'file-service://file-E1a1DbKA4fTrxJ5GVsHa6k', 'size_bytes': 100696, 'width': 834, 'height': 1357, 'fovea': None, 'metadata': {'dalle': None, 'gizmo': None, 'generation': None, 'container_pixel_height': None, 'container_pixel_width': None, 'emu_omit_glimpse_image': None, 'emu_patches_override': None, 'lpe_keep_patch_ijhw': None, 'sanitized': True, 'asset_pointer_link': None, 'watermarked_asset_pointer': None}}
